title: Embedding Digital Self-Service on Retailer Website
content:
• Home
  • ››Manhattan Active® Omni
  • ››Order Management
  • ››Process & Configuration Guides
  • ››Digital Self-Service
  • ››Embedding Digital Self-Service on Retailer Website

Embedding Digital Self-Service on Retailer's Website

  • Overview
  • How to Enable
    • Pre-requisites necessary to embed Digital Self-Service SDK in the retailer's web page
    • Adding the Manhattan Web SDK
    • Adding a sample Digital Self-Service feature element to the retailer's web page  
    • Summary

Overview

This feature allows retailers to embed Digital Self-Service features within their web experiences. For example, a customer may navigate to their Order History page on the e-commerce site and be presented with options to edit their order. When the customer selects an action like Cancel, the Digital Self-Service cancelation flow can be launched within the shell of the retailer's website, as opposed to launching a new browser tab. 

These Digital Self-Services features are available to embed : 

  • Manage my Orders
  • Shipment Tracking
  • Return / Exchange Creation
  • Return Tracking
  • Manage my Returns
  • Change Shipping Address
  • Ship it Instead
  • Pay by Link
  • Curbside Pickup
  • Extend Pickup Window
  • Alternate Pickup Person
  • Payment Recovery
  • Refund by Link
  • NPS Survey

How to Enable

Pre-requisites necessary to embed Digital Self-Service SDK in the retailer's web page
  1. Set up the Zuul configuration for the given Omni environment. Ensure the property “manh.security.login.sfdc-auth=true” is added as an entry in the application.properties file of the 'zuulserver' component. 
Please contact the Services team to add the above property to the application.properties file for the specific client located in the Stash Repository.

A sample location is: https://{{Stash Repository URL}}/projects/<CLIENT_NAME>/repos/active-omni-eom-configuration/commits/<COMMIT_ID>#config/com-manh-cp-zuulserver,<client_name>/application.properties

                    2. Ensure access to the retailer's website codebase.

                    3. Obtain the necessary credentials (domain, order ID, token, and org ID) to interact with the Digital Self-Service SDK.

Adding the Manhattan Web SDK

In the retailer’s main application index file (usually index.html or the main template file), add the Manhattan Self-Service SDK as a script in the <head> section:

<script src="https://cdn.manh.cloud/selfservice/websdk/latest/selfservice.js"></script>

 

Note: Ensure the CDN path is exactly as shown above.

Adding a sample Digital Self-Service feature element to the retailer's web page
 

Once the Manhattan Web SDK is added, you can use the custom Digital Self-Service feature element, to enable corresponding Self-Service feature functionality. Below is a sample implementation using Vue.js. This setup ensures seamless integration of Manhattan's self-service cancel functionality into the retailer's website.

Explanation of Components

  1. Form Elements: Capture domain, orderId, token, and orgId from the user.
  2. Custom Element (example <manh-dss-cancel>)
    1. Action: Defines the action type (Manh::DSS::Cancel).
    2. Domain, orderId, token, orgId: Pass the necessary parameters dynamically. In the example listed below, parameters are passed using Vue.js bindings (v-model).
  3. Submission Handling: The form prevents default submission and ensures values are set before triggering the custom element (i.e. <manh-dss-cancel> component in the example below)
<template>
  <div class="container-fluid">
    <div class="row">
      <div class="col-12">
        <form class="form-element" @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
          <div class="col-4 form-group">
            <label for="domain">Domain:</label>
            <input type="text" id="domain" v-model="domain" required class="form-control" />
          </div>
          <div class="col-4 form-group">
            <label for="orderId">Order ID:</label>
            <input type="text" id="orderId" v-model="orderId" required class="form-control" />
          </div>
          <div class="col-4 form-group">
            <label for="token">Token:</label>
            <input type="text" id="token" v-model="token" required class="form-control" />
          </div>
          <div class="col-4 form-group">
            <label for="orgId">Org ID:</label>
            <input type="text" id="orgId" v-model="orgId" required class="form-control" />
          </div>
          <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary">Submit</button>
        </form>
      </div>
      <div class="col-12">
        <manh-dss-cancel ref="manhDssCancel"
          action="Manh::DSS::Cancel"
          :domain="domain"
          :orderId="orderId"
          :token="token"
          :orgId="orgId">
        </manh-dss-cancel>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</template>
 
Summary
  1.  Include the Manhattan Web SDK in the retailer’s website.
  2.  Implement the desired feature's custom element (for example, <manh-dss-cancel>).
  3.  Capture the required user inputs dynamically.
  4.  Bind inputs to the custom element for completing the actions in the desired feature (for example, Order Cancellation).
